home.title: Chrome Extension Scout
home.subtitle: A system for structured niche discovery in Chrome Web Store: category demand, quality gaps, and auto-ranked opportunities.

modules.title: Market
modules.description: Category map, demand, density, and fast drill-down to Category Explorer.

modules.title: Opportunities
modules.description: Auto-ranked shortlist by score with bubble map and table.

modules.title: Scoring Model
modules.description: Transparent score formula and normalized factors behind opportunities.

home.workflowDescription: A quick path from market overview to final shortlist.
workflow: Open Market and identify categories with strong demand and visible quality gap.
Drill down into Category Explorer and inspect distributions plus extension table.
Validate candidates in Opportunities and build a shortlist for deeper research.
home.notesDescription: Current MVP baseline for analytical work.
home.notesFooter: Market, Category Explorer, and Opportunities are available in this MVP.

scoring.title: Scoring Model
scoring.description: How opportunity score is calculated in MVP.
scoring.demandNormText: log-normalized users against p95 users, clamped to 0..1.
scoring.competitionNormText: log-normalized category competition count against p95, clamped to 0..1.
scoring.confidenceNormText: log-normalized rating votes against p95, clamped to 0..1.
scoring.constantsDescription: MVP constants used in SQL scoring pipeline.

client.pageDescription: Category overview with filters synced to URL query params.
client.tableHint: Click category name or Open button to enter Category Explorer.
client.noData: No categories match the current filters. Adjust filters and try again.
client.hintExtensionsText: Count of unique extensions in category after global filters.
client.hintUsersText: Aggregated users across filtered extensions in category.
client.hintUnderservedText: users_norm * (1 - rating_norm); higher means stronger gap between demand and quality.

charts.interpretationUnderserved: Interpretation: higher underserved index = stronger demand-quality gap.
charts.interpretationHeat: Interpretation: larger area = demand, warmer color = larger quality gap.
charts.interpretationDemand: Interpretation: higher bar = larger demand pool in this category.
charts.interpretationDensity: Interpretation: higher bar = denser competition in this category.
charts.descriptionUnderserved: Categories sorted by underserved index, highest first. Click a bar to open.
charts.hintUnderserved: Bars rank categories by underserved_index = users_norm * (1 - rating_norm). Higher values suggest a category where demand is strong relative to perceived quality. Use it as a prioritization signal, not as absolute truth.
charts.descriptionHeatmap: Rectangle area = demand (log users). Rectangle color = underserved index. Click a tile to open.
charts.hintHeatmap: Each tile is a category. Tile area represents log-scaled users (demand size), color encodes underserved_index. Large and warm tiles are usually the first candidates for deeper exploration.
charts.descriptionDistribution: Demand and category density. Click a bar to open.
charts.hintDistribution: Demand compares category demand volumes, while Density compares category crowding by extension count. Prefer categories with solid demand and moderate density.

client.pageDescription: Deep dive inside one category with scatter, distributions, and extensions table.
client.noData: No extensions match the current filters for this category. Adjust filters and try again.
client.hintUsersText: Absolute demand signal for each extension.
client.hintRatingText: Current extension quality score from CWS.
client.hintGapText: category_avg_rating - extension_rating. Positive gap means baseline is higher than extension rating.
client.hintUpdatedText: Last known update timestamp (raw store value).

charts.interpretationScatter: Interpretation: high X with lower rating can signal unmet quality in a high-demand segment.
charts.interpretationUsersHist: Interpretation: peak buckets show where most products cluster by demand size.
charts.interpretationRatingHist: Interpretation: buckets reveal quality concentration and tail risk at low ratings.
charts.descriptionScatter: X: log1p(users), Y: rating, bubble size: rating votes, color: blended gap + demand signal.
charts.hintScatter: Each point is an extension. X shows log-scaled demand, Y shows rating, bubble size shows vote depth, and color shows a blended signal (65% quality gap + 35% demand). Toward lime means stronger opportunity pressure. Priority areas are high-demand points with weaker ratings and meaningful vote support. Mouse wheel zooms both axes, drag pans following cursor movement, and double-click empty space resets zoom. Click a point to open the extension in Chrome Web Store.
charts.hintUsersHist: Distribution of extensions by log-scaled users buckets. It helps detect whether the category is dominated by a few leaders or spread across mid-tier products.
charts.hintRatingHist: Distribution of extensions by rating buckets (0.25 step). It helps identify overall quality level and whether low-rated supply is substantial.

client.pageDescription: Auto-ranked shortlist of category-extension opportunities based on demand, gap, and competition.
client.noData: No opportunities match the current filters. Adjust filters and try again.
client.hintUsersText: Absolute user base for extension demand signal.
client.hintCategoryAvgText: Bayesian-smoothed average rating of the category baseline.
client.hintCompetitionText: Number of filtered extensions in the same category.
client.hintScoreText: Final opportunity rank = demand + effective gap + inverse competition.

charts.title: Opportunity Bubble Map
charts.description: X: log1p(users) visual scale, Y: effective gap, size: inverse competition, color: category.
charts.hintText: X uses log1p(users) only for visual spread. Y shows effective gap (rating gap weighted by confidence). Bubble size grows when competition is lower. Strong candidates are usually high on Y, larger in size, and high in score. Mouse wheel zooms both axes, drag pans following cursor movement, and double-click empty space resets zoom. Click a point to open Chrome Web Store; double-click a point to open Category Explorer.
charts.interpretation: Interpretation: higher Y + larger bubble + high score = stronger opportunity signal.
